subject: Re: [junit] JUnit considered problematic. Part III
msgSnippet: ... [...] ... I think this discussion would be more appropriate on a mailing list for discussing changes to Java and javac.
messageBody:
"javainsel" <javainsel@...> wrote:
> Now let me again try to convince you that JUnit is only accepted
> today because of a powerty of Java language.
[...]
> It should be very easy to modify the java compiler to check whether
> the implementation obeys the preconditions and postconditions and
> invariants.

I think this discussion would be more appropriate on a mailing list for
discussing changes to Java and javac.
